alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:52PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Imperial and Riverside Counties through 345 PM PDT... At 252 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Desert Center, moving northwest at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Desert Center and Eagle Mtn. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 90 and 139. CA Route 177 between mile markers 1 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West
